meanings.definition: To have been caught in a trap or snare.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit got loxed in the hunter's trap.
meanings.sent2: The spider loxed its prey in the web.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon got loxed in the garbage can lid.
meanings.sent4: Her shoelaces loxed together, causing her to trip.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's net loxed a variety of sea creatures.

meanings.definition: To have been entangled or involved in a difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt loxed in a web of lies.
meanings.sent2: The hiker loxed in a maze of trails in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The detective got loxed in a complex case.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were loxed in a web of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The students were loxed in a challenging math problem.

meanings.definition: To have been secured or fastened in place.
meanings.sent1: The gate loxed shut to keep the dog inside.
meanings.sent2: The lock loxed the door securely.
meanings.sent3: The lid of the jar loxed tightly, making it hard to open.
meanings.sent4: The seatbelt loxed in place to keep the passenger safe.
meanings.sent5: The anchor loxed the boat to the dock.

meanings.definition: To have been fixed or positioned firmly.
meanings.sent1: The sign was loxed in the ground to show the way.
meanings.sent2: The tree was loxed in the soil, standing tall.
meanings.sent3: The shelf was loxed securely to the wall.
meanings.sent4: The flagpole was loxed in the concrete base.
meanings.sent5: The statue was loxed in the center of the park.

meanings.definition: To have been tangled or twisted together.
meanings.sent1: The wires loxed together, causing a short circuit.
meanings.sent2: The vines loxed around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: Her hair loxed in knots after a windy day.
meanings.sent4: The threads loxed in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent5: The ropes loxed together, creating a strong bond.
